name: Love of the Glove
description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

key_work.title: Nintendo NES Power Glove
key_work.brief_description: There was nothing cooler than the Power Glove in 1989, thanks to a marketing blitz that heralded the Power Glove as the next best thing in gaming. Too bad it didn’t work very well.

constellations_primary.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_primary.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

start.title: Kung Fury
start.creator_credit: David Sandberg, Eleni Young, Linus Andersson and Lampray
start.brief_description: During an unfortunate series of events, a friend of Kung Fury is assassinated by the most dangerous kung fu master criminal of all time, Adolf Hitler, a.k.a Kung Führer. Kung Fury decides to travel back in time to Nazi Germany in order to kill Hitler and end the Nazi empire once and for all.

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

end.title: Theodore Rex
end.creator_credit: Richard Gilbert Abramson, J&M Entertainment and Shooting Star Entertainment
end.brief_description: In an alternate futuristic society, a tough female police detective is paired with a talking dinosaur to find the killer of dinosaurs and other prehistoric animals leading them to a mad scientist bent on creating a new Armageddon.

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

links.description: One of the main characters in Kung Fury is Triceracop, a dinosaur police officer. This is a reference to mid 90s flop Theodore Rex, a buddy cop movie featuring Whoopi Goldberg and her dinosaur cop partner.

start.title: Nintendo NES Power Glove
start.brief_description: There was nothing cooler than the Power Glove in 1989, thanks to a marketing blitz that heralded the Power Glove as the next best thing in gaming. Too bad it didn’t work very well.

constellations_primary.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

end.title: The Wizard
end.brief_description: Corey refuses to let his younger brother Jimmy be institutionalised, and the two run away together. They soon join forces with a resourceful girl, who notices that Jimmy has a special talent: he can achieve the high score on absolutely every videogame he plays.

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

links.description: The Wizard is a road movie about three children trying to attend the ‘Videogame Armageddon’ championships, and features abundant product placement from Nintendo - including the now infamous Powerglove.

links.description: Kung Fury, a cult over-the-top homage to 80s action flicks features the character of Hackerman. One of his essential pieces of equipment is the Nintendo Powerglove.

start.title: The Wizard
start.brief_description: Corey refuses to let his younger brother Jimmy be institutionalised, and the two run away together. They soon join forces with a resourceful girl, who notices that Jimmy has a special talent: he can achieve the high score on absolutely every videogame he plays.

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

end.title: Regular Show
end.brief_description: Two bored groundskeepers, Mordecai (a six-foot-tall blue jay) and Rigby (a hyperactive raccoon) are best friends who spend their days trying to entertain themselves by any means necessary, much to the displeasure of their boss. Their everyday pursuits often lead to things spiraling out of control and into the surreal.

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

links.description: The third season episode of Regular Show, ‘Video Game Wizard’, directly references The Wizard. Main characters Rigby and Mordecai compete for The Maximum Glove, with an advertisement in show quoting a line virtually identical to that of the character Lucas.

start.title: The Wizard
start.brief_description: Corey refuses to let his younger brother Jimmy be institutionalised, and the two run away together. They soon join forces with a resourceful girl, who notices that Jimmy has a special talent: he can achieve the high score on absolutely every videogame he plays.

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

end.title: Rad Racer
end.brief_description: This is no ordinary game pak. This is Rad Racer. Nintendo’s thrilling 3-D video game Rad Racer comes action-packed with revolutionary 3-D technology and 3-D glasses (they’re free inside) that will have you really believing you’re in the middle of a cross-country rally race - cruising along at 200 miles per hour! Rad Racer takes you through 8 treacherous race courses including the Los Angeles Nightway, the San Francisco Highway and the Grand Canyon. Choose the Ferrari and you’ll enter a Super Machine competition where you’ll race against Corvettes and Lamborghinis. Select the F-1 Machine and you’ll compete against incredibly fast cars. Whether it’s Ferrari or F-1, 3-D or regular mode, Rad Racer’s hairpin curves, daredevil turns and realistic action will bring home all the fun and excitement of real rally racing. Think you’re up to it? Then drivers, start your engines. It’s Rad Racer!

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

links.description: In perhaps the most memorable scene in The Wizard film, villain Lucas plays the Nintendo Entertainment System racing game Rad Racer and says, ‘I love the Power Glove. It’s so bad.’
